unnormalised: **Environmental News: Mumbai Tackling Waste Woes with New Initiative**
normalised: **environmental news: mumbai tackling waste woes with new initiative**

unnormalised: Hey there, eco-conscious folks! Mumbai, the city of dreams (and unfortunately, a lot of waste), is getting a little greener thanks to a new waste management initiative. Remember that iconic scene in "Lage Raho Munna Bhai" where Sanjay Dutt lectures folks on cleanliness? Well, maybe this is a step closer to that ideal!
normalised: hey there, eco-conscious folks! mumbai, the city of dreams (and unfortunately, a lot of waste), is getting a little greener thanks to a new waste management initiative. remember that iconic scene in "lage raho munna bhai" where sanjay dutt lectures folks on cleanliness? well, maybe this is a step closer to that ideal!

unnormalised: The BMC (Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation) is partnering with IIT Bombay to implement a pilot project focused on source segregation. That means separating your *sukha kachra* (dry waste) from your *geela kachra* (wet waste) right at home, folks!
normalised: the B M C (brihanmumbai municipal corporation) is partnering with I I T bombay to implement a pilot project focused on source segregation. that means separating your *sukha kachra* (dry waste) from your *geela kachra* (wet waste) right at home, folks!

unnormalised: They're starting in Ward H-West, covering areas like Bandra and Khar. The goal? To reduce the amount of waste going to landfills by, get this, 30% in just 6 months! Initial reports say they’re aiming to divert around 100 tonnes of waste daily.
normalised: they're starting in ward H-west, covering areas like bandra and khar. the goal? to reduce the amount of waste going to landfills by, get this, thirty percent in just six months! initial reports say they’re aiming to divert around one hundred tonnes of waste daily.

unnormalised: Volunteers will be going door-to-door, educating residents on proper segregation techniques. Let’s hope this brings about a significant change and makes Mumbai a cleaner, healthier place to live for everyone. Maybe even earn us some Gandhigiri points! The project has an estimated budget of Rs. 50 Lakhs. Watch this space for more updates!
normalised: volunteers will be going door-to-door, educating residents on proper segregation techniques. let’s hope this brings about a significant change and makes mumbai a cleaner, healthier place to live for everyone. maybe even earn us some gandhigiri points! the project has an estimated budget of rupee fifty lakhs. watch this space for more updates!
